intro: Endostephium, commonly known as the "buttercup moss," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plants produce clusters of small, yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. Endostephium species are known for their ability to thrive in wetlands and along stream banks. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
